newsitem.title: USA: James Rubin named spokesman for U.S. State Dept.
newsitem.headline: James Rubin named spokesman for U.S. State Dept.

text.p: James Rubin, a long-time close aide of Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, was named as State Department spokesman on Friday.
Rubin, 37, a former aide to Democratic Sen. Joseph Biden of Delaware, was Albright's spokesman in her previous post as ambassador to the United Nations.
The White House announced Rubin would be nominated as assistant secretary of state for public affairs.
He will succeed Nicholas Burns, who officials said was expected to be nominated by President Bill Clinton as ambassador to Greece.
